Friends of Kyrgyzstan

A place to connect with others who love Kyrgyzstan.

What Is Friends of Kyrgyzstan?

FOK’s mission is to facilitate communication among members and promote exchange of information by responding to requests for and sharing information about Kyrgyzstan and facilitating the sharing and exchange of ideas, activities, materials, resources and expertise among members and others.

We focus on representing the Peace Corps experience and support the continual learning of members in areas related to the culture, country and development of Kyrgyzstan including the promotion and facilitation of projects our members undertake with this aim.

Dialogue

We promote continuous dialogue regarding the work Peace Corps Volunteers have accomplished in Kyrgyzstan by hosting meet ups, online conversations, and representing our cumulative experiences to community and government leaders.

Fundraising

We support projects of current Peace Corps Volunteers in Kyrgyzstan through grants we fund with the generosity of our supporters. We are a registered 501(c)3 organization. Make your tax-deductible donation today.

Why not travel the world, learn a new language, meet amazing people, challenge yourself, and live life to the fullest?

Тынчтык Корпусунун волонтеру Мэт Пруит жана анын каунтерпарты ...

Peace Corps Volunteer Matt Pruitt and counterpart Umut on Team Teaching and new English methodologies in Naryn. ----------- Тынчтык Корпусунун волонтеру Мэт Пруит жана анын каунтерпарты Умут биргелешип окутуу жана англис тилин уйротуудо жаны методологияны колдонуу убагында.

Posted by Peace Corps Kyrgyz Republic on Tuesday, May 10, 2016

If you are an RPCV who served in Kyrgyzstan, are interested in serving in Kyrgyzstan, a Kyrgyz national or have a general interest in Kyrgyzstan and Central Asia, we would love to hear from you! Please use this form to get in touch.

We also invite you to like us on Facebook.

Friends of Kyrgyzstan on Facebook

We'll never share your email with anyone else.

Friends of Kyrgyzstan is a registered 501(c)3 organization and is not associated with the United States Peace Corps. The views and information expressed here are our own and do not necessarily reflect the opinions or policies of either the United States Peace Corps or it’s volunteers.
